sentences.english: Andrew was not ashamed to find that tears were coursing down his face.
sentences.chinese: 安德魯淚如泉湧，卻並不爲之慚愧。

sentences.english: He perseveres in his work makes us shame.
sentences.chinese: 他孜孜不倦的幹勁使我們大家慚愧。

sentences.english: I was ashamed to write my feeling about the movie "Cape No. 7".
sentences.chinese: 說來很慚愧，我今天才看完《海角七號》這部電影。

sentences.english: Butler was sorry that he had called his youngest a baggage .
sentences.chinese: 巴特勒罵自己的小女兒是小娼婦，也覺得很慚愧。

sentences.english: Many foreigners' knowledge of Chinese history put us to shame.
sentences.chinese: 很多外國人對中國歷史的瞭解令我們自感慚愧。

sentences.english: One of the authors is blushing from making that mistake.
sentences.chinese: 本文的作者之一就非常慚愧地犯了這個錯誤。

sentences.english: Are you afraid to expose your shame or guilt?
sentences.chinese: 你害怕暴露自己的慚愧和內疚嗎？

sentences.english: I really don't know how to express how sorry I am.
sentences.chinese: 我真不知道該怎麼表達我內心的慚愧。

sentences.english: Oh God, for shame! I do not even know your name.
sentences.chinese: 喔，上帝啊，慚愧啊，我甚至連她的芳名都不知道。

sentences.english: Hearing this, Mencius felt very ashamed and immediately went to apologize to his wife.
sentences.chinese: 孟子聽了非常慚愧，急忙向妻子道歉。

sentences.english: You should be abashed to commit such immoral crime.
sentences.chinese: 你應該爲你所犯下的不人道罪刑感到慚愧。

sentences.english: They shall be ashamed, and also confounded, all of them: they shall go to confusion together that are makers of idols.
sentences.chinese: 凡製造偶像的，都必抱愧蒙羞，都要一同歸於慚愧。

sentences.english: The Chinese, let us confess it to our shame, knew it before us.
sentences.chinese: 中國人，說來令人慚愧，比我們知道得早。

sentences.english: Tell the truth and shame the devil.
Words cannot describe how sorry I am.
sentences.chinese: 我內心的慚愧難以形容。

sentences.english: B: I do feel sorry for what I have done.
sentences.chinese: 我確實爲自己所做的事感到慚愧。

definition: guilty conscience/to feel a twinge of guilt
to move emotionally/to stir up (emotions)/to excite
unworthy/to let down/I'm sorry/excuse me/pardon me/if you please/sorry? (please repeat)
to grieve/to be broken-hearted/to feel deeply hurt
to cherish the memory of/to think of/reminisce
